p: The substantial differences observed indicate differences in the starch granule, such as a more rigid granular structure in the red variety [ 55]. Lower onset (T 0) and peak (T p) temperatures were obtained in the study as compared to cowpea (T p = 86°C) [ 56]. Enthalpy of gelatinization (ΔH) of flour from raw seeds of the two varieties (4.1 and 4.8 J/g) was lower than the 6.0–9.7 J/g reported by Sirivongpaisal [ 54] and Kaptso, Njintang [ 34].
